author: Khaleej Times
title: Summit on future cities to be held in Dubai
text:
(MENAFN - Khaleej Times)The third International Conference on Investment in Future Cities will explore and generate ideas for a consistent vision and a collaborative pathway leading to a lucrative return on the sustainable investment. 


Dubai — Meik Wiking director of the Happiness Research Institute in Denmark will address the topic “Creating an attractive vision for the future city – a Danish case study” during the two-day Investors’ Summit – Future Cities planned for May 4 and 5 2016 in Dubai. 
Wiking leads a think-tank aiming to inform decision makers of the causes and effects of human happiness make subjective well-being part of the public policy debate and improve the quality of life for citizens across the world by partnering with cities and policy makers. He will take the audience through some of the aspects of citizen and community engagement. As investment in the property sector increases so nature and the resources it can supply are placed under further stress. Planners and developers need not only to reduce the resource consumption of new and existing cities but at the same time to make them more resilient in the face of climate change healthier and more productive places to live and work. 
The third International Conference on Investment in Future Cities will explore and generate ideas for a consistent vision and a collaborative pathway leading to a lucrative return on the sustainable investment. 
—
